intro: Anotis decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive anotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a sprawling, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Anotis decipiens is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and maritime climates.
